alert.note: Alert for Western Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 24 at 4:01PM AKDT until June 25 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 10 PM AKDT SATURDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE WESTERN ALASKA RANGE... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS, which is in effect from 1 PM to 10 PM AKDT Saturday. * Winds...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 20 mph. * Timing...Hot, dry and windy conditions are expected from 1 pm to 10 pm Saturday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 25 percent. * Temperatures...70 to 80 degrees. 60s over higher elevations. * Location...Valleys and foothills along the western Alaska Range, including Stoney and Port Alsworth * Impacts...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or occurring now, or will shortly. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public.
